intro: Steganthera oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved steganthera, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
